ygData.subject: Re: The great panic
ygData.msgSnippet: The Rogues pull up to avoid the brunt of the explosion, but it disrupts their cloaking devices (and singes a few armor plates) anyway. Riekan is the nearest

The Rogues pull up to avoid the brunt of the explosion, but it 
disrupts their cloaking devices (and singes a few armor plates) 
anyway.

Riekan is the nearest Rogue to Dreadplague, but he sees her coming 
and parries her sword with his shark-fin blade, letting her land on 
the muzzle of his harpoon gun.  "I don't have to," he hisses as he 
looses a dragline harpoon - it's too close for an explosive bolt.  
The gun packs quite a punch; at this range, it would be more than 
enough to send the spear-like projectile through any known armor 
plating, including technorganic-2's.

Fury dives in on the femme from behind, retracting his lashknife into 
a short sword and swiping at Dreadplague's back.

The two female Rogues (both in vehicle mode) go for Tyreal, Noir 
launching more of her missiles and Jayde firing ion bursts.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
<wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Dreadplague was aware of the tactic.
> 
> Dreadplague: Up now!
> 
> She and Tyrael jumped high in the air. Turning around, her cloak
> flying in the air, She charged two massive plasma balls and fired
> right where they had been. It was undeniable that the explosion 
would
> get the Rogues.
> 
> After that, she took hold of her sword and fell down with it facing
> downward to impale the first unlucky miserable that would get in 
the way.
> 
> Her voice became a raucous and guttural one.
> 
> Dread: You can not hide from me!
> 
> Tyrael did not know where to attack, so he decided to shoot
> needle-like light pins in a cone-manner and reduce the cone until he
> caught a Rogue or two.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
> <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > The attack comes from four different directions, as the Rogues 
cloak 
> > and split up before sweeping in to strafe the Tripreds from the 
> > points of the compass.  An old, but effective tactic - no matter 
> > where you look, you're turning your back on a Rogue, and that can 
be 
> > a fatal error.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
> > <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > Dreadplague raised an eyebrow.
> > > 
> > > Dreadplague: Oh? I hadn't realized we had an ally here.
> > > 
> > > She stopped affecting Kaiser with panic and she saw the Rogues 
were
> > > starting to get up and were likely to be on her. She raised her 
> > sword
> > > defiantly.
> > > 
> > > Dreadplague: I think we start to fight now, right, father?
> > > 
> > > Tyrael: This looks like it... Show them what you are made of!
> > > 
> > > They both stood ready for the insoming assault, Dread with her 
sword
> > > and Tyrael with his talon.
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
> > > <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > > Devilcat is undeterred, letting off a lightning-quick flurry 
of 
> > > > attacks: he slashes with his sword, then launches a kick from 
the 
> > > > other side, and finally fires a point-blank burst from his 
chest-
> > > > mounted subspace cannon.  All of this takes about two seconds.
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Rudra656@a... wrote:
> > > > > ::Kaiser::
> > > > >        His breathing accelerates wildly before he manages 
to 
> > grab a 
> > > > hold of 
> > > > > himself.  He transforms into his griffin form and deflects 
> > > > Devilcat's slash 
> > > > > with a metallic talon.  Calming himself he focuses his 
energy 
> > on 
> > > > the battle, 
> > > > > forcing himself into the emotionless zone of battle.
